intro: Tanacetum tauricum, commonly known as the Crimean tansy, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves and yellow button-like flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Tanacetum tauricum is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
